task.title: How to Configure a Berkeley DB XML Data Source

keywords.indexterm: Native XML Databases (NXD)data sources configurationBerkeley DB XML

context.p: The latest instructions on how to configure Berkeley DB XML support in can be found on our website.
The latest instructions on how to configure Berkeley DB XML support in can be found on our website.

step.cmd: Go to menu Preferences Data Sources .
Click the New button in the Data Sources panel.
Enter a unique name for the data source.
Select Berkeley DBXML from the Driver type combo box.
Press the Add button to add the Berkeley DB driver files.

info.p: The driver files for the Berkeley DB database are the following:

ul.li: db.jar (check for it into DBXML_DIR / lib or DBXML_DIR / jar)
dbxml.jar (check for it into DBXML_DIR / lib or DBXML_DIR / jar)

info.p: Where DBXML_DIR is the Berkeley DB XML database root directory. For example on Windows it is: C:\Program Files\Oracle\Berkeley DB XML <version>.

step.cmd: Click the OK button to finish the data source configuration.
